resources.string: Have you ever found yourself hungry in the wilderness without the expertise of a survival expert? Well now you have one in your pocket! Simply plug in the features of the mushroom you wish to examine as prompted, and Mushroom Analyzer will use its machine learning classification system to identify the mushroom as edible or poisonous. Using our application, one can identify mushrooms with reliable accuracy and reduce the amount of time that would otherwise go towards biological testing. The mushrooms in the data set are from the Lepiota and Agaricus genera and thus this application should not be used with other mushrooms.\n\nThis application represents the combined efforts of four students at Santa Clara University attempting to test and utilize different open-source libraries. The application employs WEKA, a java-based toolkit implemented specifically to expedite several analysis processes.

Caution!

Never eat mushrooms that have been identified with this app.

The consumption of mushrooms always happens at your own risk.

The app can not replace the advice of an experienced professional. It provides only basic knowledge to simplify the mushroom identification. The data is based on the actual state of knowledge and professional experience. However we can not give any guarantee for the correctness of the edibility-values.

Continue if you agree with these conditions.
Start by smelling the mushroom.\nWhat does it smell like?
Now look at the mushroom\'s gills.\nHow are they spaced?
Now look at the stalk of the mushroom.\nWhat is the surface like above the ring?
Now look at the spore print.\nWhat color is it?
What population do the mushrooms come in?
